result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald Joseph Neita was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all MANDATORY cost, fees and surcharges by 1/4/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. NON-MANDATORY cost, fees and surcharges are waived due to financial instability.
Consecutive to: to any sentence. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald Joseph Neita

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gerald Joseph Neita in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Gerald Joseph Neita in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 65 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 65 days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all MANDATORY cost, fees and surcharges by 1/4/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.  NON-MANDATORY cost, fees and surcharges are waived due to financial instablilty.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Gerald Joseph Neita in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Gerald Joseph Neita in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  No hearing is requested.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.
from Wisconsin Forensic unit, Deborah L. Collins, Psy.D., ABPP, received and filed. lms
from the defendant, received and filed. lms

Defendant Gerald Joseph Neita in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Gerald Joseph Neita in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Gerald Joseph Neita in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Gerald Joseph Neita in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Barbara K Due in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Case adjourned to branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Barbara K Due in court, defendant Gerald Joseph Neita not in court, in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.

Defendant is awaiting transport. Case adjourned to branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant is awaiting transport.    Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Per email from case manager.  Case is adjourned from 4/29/2015 to 4/22/2015 at 9:30am. lms

Review hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

ORDER: IT IS HEARBY ORDERED that the Milwaukee County Correctional Facility-Central and/or Community Correctional Facility-South medical staff immediately provide Gerald Neita with a liver function test.  The results of the test shall be returned to this court as soon as they are received.  Signed and filed. lms

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Gerald Joseph Neita in court with attorney Cynthia Mercedes Wynn.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction for a period of 9 months.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 6. LR  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 01-14-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Cynthia Mercedes Wynn in court, defendant Gerald Joseph Neita not in court, in custody.  George David Kidd appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defense motion to modify bail argued and granted by the Court. Bail: $500.00 PR BOND WITH TOT TO JUSTICE POINT FOR RELEASE TO THE VA HOSPITAL ONLY FOR INPATIENT TREATMENT.     BAIL MOTION EFFECTIVE 1-13-15.

Defendant Gerald Joseph Neita in court with attorney Cynthia Mercedes Wynn.  Defendant Gerald Joseph Neita in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 47. Bail motion taken under advisment.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 01-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Gerald Joseph Neita in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Gerald Joseph Neita in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
